title: Look In
focus: Examining heart posture, vocational alignment, and internal convictions.
description: Turn inward to explore your convictions, identity in Christ, and inner dialogue across body, mind, and spirit.
reflection: Understanding our motivations and convictions is crucial for our spiritual growth and integrity. Our motivations drive our actions, and our convictions shape our beliefs and values. By examining these internal aspects, we can ensure that our actions align with God's will and our faith. This self-awareness helps us to live authentically and purposefully, guided by the Holy Spirit. Reflect on what motivates you and the convictions that underpin your faith. Are they rooted in God's truth and love, or are they influenced by external pressures and personal desires?
verse: Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting. - Psalm 139:23-24 (NIV)
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with open hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to examine our motivations and convictions with honesty and humility. Reveal to us any areas where we may be driven by selfish desires or influenced by external pressures. Purify our hearts and align our intentions with Your will. May our actions reflect Your love and truth, and may our convictions be firmly rooted in Your Word. Lead us in the way everlasting, and empower us to live lives that honor and glorify You. In Jesus' name, we pray. Amen.

tasks.description: Write a prayer of confession, lament, or gratitude focused on one heart issue; note emotional and spiritual shifts.
Journal recurring thoughts or dreams for two weeks, marking patterns in mind and heart.
Share a significant conviction or struggle with a trusted mentor or peer.
Meditate on identity passages (e.g., Galatians 2:20); practice centering prayer with mindful breathing.
